trans-unit.source: Patroni is a template for you to create your own customized, high-availability solution using Python and - for maximum accessibility - a distributed configuration store like ZooKeeper, etcd, Consul or Kubernetes. Database engineers, DBAs, DevOps engineers, and SREs who are looking to quickly deploy HA PostgreSQL in the datacenter-or anywhere else-will hopefully find it useful.
trans-unit.target: Patroni is a template for you to create your own customized, high-availability solution using Python and - for maximum accessibility - a distributed configuration store like ZooKeeper, etcd, Consul or Kubernetes. Database engineers, DBAs, DevOps engineers, and SREs who are looking to quickly deploy HA PostgreSQL in the datacenter-or anywhere else-will hopefully find it useful.

trans-unit.source: Patroni is in active development and accepts contributions. See our Contributing section below for more details.
trans-unit.target: Patroni is in active development and accepts contributions. See our Contributing section below for more details.

trans-unit.source: Patroni originated as a fork of Governor, the project from Compose. It includes plenty of new features.
trans-unit.target: Patroni originated as a fork of Governor, the project from Compose. It includes plenty of new features.

trans-unit.source: Patroni provides an HAProxy configuration, which will give your application a single endpoint for connecting to the cluster’s leader. To configure, run:

trans-unit.source: There are two places to connect with the Patroni community: on github, via Issues and PRs, and on channel #patroni in the PostgreSQL Slack. If you’re using Patroni, or just interested, please join us.

trans-unit.source: We call Patroni a “template” because it is far from being a one-size-fits-all or plug-and-play replication system. It will have its own caveats. Use wisely.
trans-unit.target: We call Patroni a “template” because it is far from being a one-size-fits-all or plug-and-play replication system. It will have its own caveats. Use wisely.

trans-unit.source: We report new releases information here.
trans-unit.target: We report new releases information here.

trans-unit.source: When connecting from an application, always use a non-superuser. Patroni requires access to the database to function properly. By using a superuser from an application, you can potentially use the entire connection pool, including the connections reserved for superusers, with the
trans-unit.target: Cuando se conecten desde una aplicación,usen siempre un no-superusuario.Patroni requiere acceso a la base de datos para funcionar correctamente.Al utilizar un superusuario desde una aplicación,puede utilizar potencialmente todo el conjunto de conexiones,incluidas las conexiones reservadas para los superusuarios,con el

trans-unit.source: settings. This setting ensures failover will not occur if a follower is more than a certain number of bytes behind the leader. This setting should be increased or decreased based on business requirements. It’s also possible to use synchronous replication for better durability guarantees. See replication modes documentation for details.
trans-unit.target: settings. This setting ensures failover will not occur if a follower is more than a certain number of bytes behind the leader. This setting should be increased or decreased based on business requirements. It’s also possible to use synchronous replication for better durability guarantees. See replication modes documentation for details.
